Houston.Williams Tower: The Williams Tower (originally named the Transco Tower) is a 64-story, 1.4-million-square-foot (130×10^3 m2) class A office tower located in the Uptown District of Houston, Texas. The building was designed by New York-based John Burgee Architects with Philip Johnson in association with Houston-based Morris-Aubry Architects (now known as Morris Architects). Construction began in August, 1981 and was completed in December, 1982.
